artist: Edward Coley Burne-Jones; William Morris; Published by Kelmscott Press; William Morris at Kelmscott Press
creditline: The Frank P. Leslie Collection, Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Frank P. Leslie in memory of Mr. and Mrs. John Leslie
description: wood-engraved ornamental borders and initial letters by William Morris; binding: blue laid paper on hard support, with beige cloth spine; endpapers: laid paper; slip case: dark green cloth on firm support
provenance:
Leslie; Princeton University (see explanation below)

Mr. Leslie bought this book in London for $500 in response to a request by Princeton University Library. In the meantime, they were given a copy so they did not need Mr. Leslie's copy. He therefore gave $1000 to Princeton to go toward a student center. . ."a project Jim '52 was promoting."

[This information was taken from a statement by Mr. Leslie in a document entitled "Exhibit A". A copy of this document is in the Leslie family file in the Prints and Drawings department, as well in the MIA library.]

10/2006
title: The Works of Geoffrey Chaucer Now Newly Imprinted
